name.description: The name of the property, e.g. for display purposes. The string is UTF-8 encoded.

semantic.description: Identifies a property with a well-known meaning. The string is UTF-8 encoded.

valueType.description: The value type of each element. `STRING` values are UTF-8 encoded.

valueByteLength.description: A fixed-size byte length for `STRING` and `BINARY` values. When omitted, values are variable-size.

elementType.description: The element type. This value must be `SINGLE` when `valueType` is `STRING` or `BINARY`.

valuesPerElement.description: The number of values per element for `ARRAY` elements.

normalized.description: Specifies whether integer values should be normalized.

max.description: Maximum allowed values for property data. Only applicable for fixed-size numeric element types (`SCALAR` and `ARRAY`). Both `min` and `max` arrays have the same length. The length is determined by `valuesPerElement`. `normalized` property has no effect on array values: they always correspond to the integer values.

min.description: Minimum allowed values for property data. Only applicable for fixed-size numeric element types (`SCALAR` and `ARRAY`). Both `min` and `max` arrays have the same length. The length is determined by `valuesPerElement`. `normalized` property has no effect on array values: they always correspond to the integer values.
